doc.description: Messages relating to X.400 P1 and P3
General PDU dump
doc.action: No Operator Action

doc.description: General notice level event: See log entry for details
doc.action: No Operator Action

doc.description: General error used for normal errors
doc.action: See log entry for details

doc.description: General error used for fatal errors
doc.action: See Log entry for details. Please send information on the occurrence of this event to support@isode.com

doc.description: General notice level event: See log entry for details
doc.action: No Operator Action

doc.description: M-Switch Error. Isode's medium term plan is to remove all common use of this event, Isode's long term plan is to remove all use of this event.
doc.action: See log entry for details.

doc.description: Fatal M-Switch Event. This event should only occur in very unusual situations. Isode's medium term plan is to remove all use of this event
doc.action: See Log entry for details. Please send information on the occurrence of this event to support@isode.com

message.name: AssocRejected
message.arg: Peer MTA to which the association was rejected

doc.description: It was not possible to connect to another MTA as the association was rejected
doc.action: May be network problem or remote MTA not running

message.name: AuthNameMismatch
message.text: Authorization failed, MTA name mismatch: expected '%1' but got '%2'
message.arg: The expected value of MTA name in the Bind
The value of MTA name received in the Bind

doc.description: It was not possible to connect to another MTA as the authentication failed. The MTA name provided in the bind is not the expected one
doc.action: Configuration error in peer MTA connection

message.name: AuthPassMismatch
message.text: Authorization failed for %1, password mismatch: expected '%2' but got '%3'
message.arg: The expected value of MTA password in the Bind
The value of MTA password received in the Bind

doc.description: It was not possible to connect to another MTA as the authentication failed. The MTA password provided in the bind is not the the expected one.
doc.action: Configuration error in peer MTA connection

message.name: AuthNullPass
message.text: Authorization failed for MTA %1, as the MTA password was NULL

doc.description: The simple authentication check failed, as the password was NULL
doc.action: Configuration error in peer MTA connection

doc.description: It was not possible to transfer a message to/from the specified MTA, and the reason is supplied.
doc.action: This error should not normally occur. Problem should be reviwed with operator of peer MTA.

message.name: StrongBindExpected
message.text: strong bind expected, but not found

doc.description: A strong bind was expected, but it wasÂ not found
Rather than connect to the first MTA, the connection is being rerouted to the second.
doc.action: No Operator Action

message.name: DoubleReroute
message.text: Rerouting MTA %1 to MTA which is rerouted

doc.description: It is not allowed to reroute an MTA to another MTA which is itself being rerouted.
doc.action: Configuration error in message routing setup

message.name: CallingAddressError
message.text: Authorization failed for MTA %1, calling address mismatch, %2 != %3

doc.description: The MTA is configured to require network address authentication, and the actual calling address does not match the expected calling address.
doc.action: Configuration error in peer MTA connection

doc.description: An invalid X.400 transfer PDU was received from the peer MTA
doc.action: Contact operator of peer X.400 MTA to diagnose problem

message.name: Aborted
message.text: Association with MTA %1 while transferring %2, reason=%3

doc.description: While transferring a message to a peer MTA, the association as aborted.
doc.action: May be problem with network or with remote MTA. Both should be investigated

doc.description: Reports the traffic class being set for the association.
doc.action: Check that the value is as expected

message.name: NoMTAParams
message.text: Cannot find MTA information for %1 (or address %2)

doc.description: Failed to find MTA connection information for the given MTA name, or by routing the ORaddress.
doc.action: Correct Routing or MTA configuration

message.name: NoPAentry
message.text: Cannot locate entry in table %1 for address %2 (key:%3)
message.arg: Calling presentation address without macros. This is the key used.

doc.description: Failed to find an entry in the channel's intable for the given calling presentation address.
doc.action: Update MTA's intable

message.name: MTAnameNotFound
message.text: Cannot find entry in external MTA table for mTAName %1
message.arg: mTAName from incoming X.400 bind operation

doc.description: Failed to find an entry in the channel's intable for the given mTAName.
doc.action: Configuration error. In EMMA, the external MTA table is the set of links visible in the X400 channel properties. These may need to be regenerated if a new MTA has been added, or if the credentials of an MTA has been changed.

message.name: NoBilateralAgreement
message.text: No bilateral agreement found for caller %1
message.arg: Directory name of the MTA's entry for which a bilateral agreement was expected.

doc.description: The channel does not have a directory-based external MTA table. It cannot use the calling mTAName to determine the caller.
doc.action: Add an external MTA entry for the remote MTA

message.name: CallingAETRequired
message.text: The caller did not supply its name in the calling AET

doc.description: The channel is configured to require that the caller supply its Directory name in the calling application entity title (AET). But the caller did not supply this information.
doc.action: Configuration error in peer MTA connection

message.name: CallingAETnotValid
message.text: Cannot find entry corresponding to AET %1
message.arg: Directory name within the calling AET.

doc.description: The channel is configured to require that the caller supply its Directory name in the calling application entity title (AET) and that the name be a valid name. There was a failure finding the entry corresponding to the supplied name.
doc.action: Configuration error in peer MTA connection

message.name: CallerLookupFailed
message.text: Failure finding information for calling MTA name=%1 address=%2

doc.description: The channel was either unable to find information to identify the calling MTA, or the information supplied failed to meet the requirements.
doc.action: Configuration error in peer MTA connection

message.name: EncodeError
message.arg: item for which the encode failed

doc.description: There was a problem encoding some data item.
doc.action: Check for more detailed logging of the problem.

message.name: DecodeError
message.arg: item for which the encode failed

doc.description: There was a problem decoding some data item.
doc.action: Check for more detailed logging of the problem.

message.name: NoAddress
message.arg: The name of the MTA being attempted

doc.description: There was no address for the remote MTA.
doc.action: Check the configuration of the channel for the remote MTA.

message.name: InvalidAddress
message.arg: The string form of the address.
The name of the MTA being attempted or the local calling address

doc.description: The address for the remote MTA is invalid.
doc.action: Check the configuration of the channel for the remote MTA.

doc.description: Remote MTA or MS is busy.
doc.action: Connection can be attempt again later.

doc.description: Remote MTA/MS rejected the credentials of the calling system.
doc.action: Check the credentials which are being sent.

doc.description: The remote MTA rejects the proposed dialogue mode.
doc.action: Change the configuration to propose a different mode.

message.name: SecurityContext
message.text: The proposed security context was rejected

doc.description: Remote MTA/MS rejected the security of the calling system.
doc.action: Check the security context which is being sent.

message.name: ValidationFailure
message.text: Remote MTA failed to validate local MTA

doc.description: The remote MTA sent an RTS validation error.
doc.action: The local MTA may not be registered with the remote MTA.

doc.description: Remote MTA has rejected the connection.
doc.action: Ask the remote MTA administrator for details.

doc.description: Remote MTA was not able to recover the association. The local MTA will attempt again without attempting recovery.
doc.action: Do not attempt to recover the association.

message.name: BadCredentials
message.arg: The detailed reason for the rejection

doc.description: The remote MTA did not send acceptable credentials.
doc.action: This is either a local configuration issue, or a compatibility issue.

message.name: StrongAuthFailed
message.arg: The detailed reason for the rejection

doc.description: The remote MTA's strong bind failed. This could be because of a problem with the credentials, or a problem with the local configuration used to check the credentials.
doc.action: Check the local strong auth trust anchors

message.name: StrongAuthProblem
message.arg: The detailed reason for the problem

doc.description: There is a local problem with strong authentication.
doc.action: Check the strong authentication configuration

message.name: InternalError
message.arg: The detailed reason for the rejection

doc.description: There is an internal problem with the configuration or the operation of the channel.
doc.action: Check the channel's configuration

message.name: ReleaseRejected
message.arg: The detailed reason for the rejection

doc.description: The local MTA attempted to release the association, but this release was rejected by the peer MTA. The local MTA aborts the association.

message.name: RTSAbort
message.arg: The operation in progress when the abort occurred.

doc.description: When performing an RTS operation, an abort was encountered.

message.name: TransferComplete
message.arg: The peer to which the message was being transferred.

doc.description: The RTS transfer of a message was already completed.

message.name: TransferDiscard
message.arg: The peer to which the message was being transferred.

doc.description: The RTS transfer of a message has been discarded as a result of too many attempts following RTS transfer discard or interrupt. The MTA will attempt the transfer later.
There was a failure to initialize the channel's connection to the Directory service.
doc.action: Check the logs for additional information. Check that the DSA is running.

doc.description: There was a failure to open the channel's connection to the Directory service.
doc.action: Check the logs for additional information. The most common reason for this is incorrect credentials for the channel (bind DN and password).

doc.description: The P3 channel has connected successfully to the UA/MS.
The P3 channel failed to connect to the UA/MS.
doc.action: Action depends upon the detailed reason for the problem.

doc.description: The given UA address is invalid.
Cannot find the message store information for the given address.
doc.action: Check the configuration of the user with the address

message.name: NoChannelInfo
message.text: Failed to get channel info for %1
message.arg: The DN of the channel being used.

doc.description: Cannot find the information for the channel. address.
doc.action: Check the configuration for the channel

message.name: NoMSaddress
message.text: Failed to get message store address for %1
message.arg: The DN of the shared message store.

doc.description: Cannot find the presentation address to call.
doc.action: Check the configuration for the message store

message.name: NoMSserver
message.text: Failed to get message store server for %1
message.arg: The DN of the shared message store.

doc.description: Cannot find the presentation address to call.
doc.action: Check the configuration for the message store

message.name: DeliveryError
message.arg: The type of object being delivered (message or report)

doc.description: The delivery of the message or report failed.
Files for resumption are held in a directory. This directory could not be opened.
doc.action: Check the directory exists, and has the correct permissions

message.name: ResumeNoSlot
message.text: No slots available in resumption directory %1

doc.description: Files for resumption are held in a directory. Only a limited set of files can be created, and this limit has been reached. These files are deleted by the trash channel when they reach a certain age. If the files accumulate, this is an indication that there may be problems with communication with certain MTAs.
doc.action: Investigate number of resumed files, to determine if there are problems with one or more peer MTAs and repeated failed transfers. Unwanted resume files can be deleted by hand

doc.description: The caller has requested association recovery, but no matching session information has been found. The channel closes the association and exits.
doc.action: No operator action needed

doc.description: There was a failure opening a file used for submission
doc.action: Check that the files exists and has the correct permissions. May be a temporary resource problem. If error repeats, configuration error is likely.

doc.description: There was a failure opening a file used to indicate submission
doc.action: Check that the directory exists and the permissions are correct

doc.description: There was a failure reading the list of files in a directory
doc.action: Check that the directory exists and the permissions are correct

message.name: NoRecipientInfo
message.text: Failed to get information for address %1

doc.description: Could not find information to enable delivery for the given address.
doc.action: Update configuration for this user

doc.description: The input X.400 message had some formatting errors and cannot be processed
doc.action: Contact operator of peer X.400 MTA to diagnose problem
